page.title: 10Tradesmen who visit Sherford
page.content: There is no village shop in Sherford but it is not difficult to buy things because there are people with mobile shops who come regularly. There is a man who comes every Monday and Thursday evenings. He sells{bread, {sweets, cakes, crisps, biscuits, {drinks, pasties and tinned food.}The { {milkman}comes in a van with an open back, he sells {milk, papers, cream {and cigarettes.}The {fishman}comes every Wednesday, he sells all shapes and sizes and kinds of{fish}at not a very high or low price. Another man comes with a large van with{fruit and {vegetables}to sell. There is also a {butcher}who comes once a week to deliver anything you order. There is also a{hairdresser and a chiropodist who come to people who need them and you can send for things from the{Mail {Order catalogues.}
